Line 44: Line 44:
In [[May 2004]], Google officially cut [[Goldman Sachs]] from the IPO, leaving [[Morgan Stanley]] and [[Credit Suisse First Boston]] as the joint underwriters.
In [[May 2004]], Google officially cut [[Goldman Sachs]] from the IPO, leaving [[Morgan Stanley]] and [[Credit Suisse First Boston]] as the joint underwriters.
â
After some initial stumbles, Google's initial public offering took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]]. 19,605,052 [[stock|shares]] were offered at a price of $85 per share. Of that, 14,142,135 were floated by Google and 5,462,917 by selling stockholders. The sale raised $1.67 billion, of which approximately $1.2 billion went to Google. The vast majority of Google's 271 million shares remained under Google's control. The IPO gave Google a [[market capitalization]] of more than $23 billion. Many of Google's employees became instant paper millionaires. Ironically [[Yahoo!]] also benefited from the IPO because it owns 2.7 million shares of Google.
+
After some initial stumbles, Google's initial public offering took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]]. 19,605,052 [[stock|shares]] were offered at a price of $85 per share. Of that, 14,142,135 were floated by Google and 5,462,917 by selling stockholders. The sale raised $1.67 billion, of which approximately $1.2 billion went to Google. The vast majority of Google's 271 million shares remained under Google's control. The IPO gave Google a [[market capitalization]] of more than $23 billion. Many of Google's employees became instant paper millionaires. Ironically [[Yahoo!]] also benefited from the IPO because it owns 2.7 million shares of Google. The company was was listed on the [[Nasdaq]] stock exchange under the [[ticker]] symbol '''GOOG'''.
â
Since the IPO, Google's stock market capitalization has risen to $46 billion and the stock price has nearly doubled. Google currently trades on the [[Nasdaq]] stock exchange under the [[ticker]] symbol '''GOOG'''.
+
Since the IPO, Google's stock market capitalization has risen to $50 billion and the stock price has doubled. On August 19 2004 the number of [[shares outstanding]] was 172.85 million while the "[[free float]]" was 19.60 million, in January 2005 the shares outstanding are 273.42 million, 53% is held by insiders which makes the float 127.70 million. The company has not reported any [[treasury stock]] holdings as of the Q3 2004 report.
''[[Image:Googler2-non.jpg|right|thumb|A [[license plate]] seen in the Googleplex parking lot]]''
''[[Image:Googler2-non.jpg|right|thumb|A [[license plate]] seen in the Googleplex parking lot]]''
